page.title: 10Chocolate factory, Alrewas
page.content: The Tudor chocolate factory is set back from the road behind the Tudor Bread and Cake shop in Main Street. It is a small flat roofed brick building painted white. The factory is owned by Mr. Burns-Mace Snr. and is managed by his son. The business began 40 years ago behind the Tudor Cafe in Lichfield but moved to larger premises here in 1975. The chocolates are well known because they are hand made, high quality products. The factory makes 250 varieties. There are filled chocolates, Easter eggs and the largest range of figures in the country. Production of eggs begins in December. The largest weighs 20 lbs and takes 1 hour to make. The factory sells goods to all the top London stores, but does not export. The workers are 12 women and boys. They work 5 days a week, from 8 am. to 4.30 pm.
